"Hurt" is a song written by Trent Reznor, first released on Nine Inch Nails&#039; 1994 album The Downward Spiral. In 2002, "Hurt" was covered by Johnny Cash to critical acclaim; it was one of Cash&#039;s final hit releases before his death. Its accompanying video, featuring images from Cash&#039;s life and directed by Mark Romanek, was named the best video of the year by the Grammy Awards and Country Music Awards.

The cover was given the Country Music Award for "Single of the Year" in 2003. It ranked as CMT&#039;s top video for 2003, #1 on CMT&#039;s 100 Greatest Country Music Videos the following year, and #1 on the Top 40 Most Memorable Music Videos on MuchMoreMusic&#039;s Listed in October 2007. As of July 2008, the single occupies the number one spot on Rate Your Music&#039;s Top Singles of the 2000s. The song is also Cash&#039;s sole chart entry on the Billboard Modern Rock Tracks chart, where it hit #33 in 2003.

The house where Cash&#039;s music video for "Hurt" was shot, which was Cash&#039;s home for nearly 30 years, was destroyed in a fire on April 10, 2007.
